title: $18/hr - Delivery Helper - Next Steps Logistics LLC - Amazon DSP
address: 19 Bob Glidden Blvd, Whiteland, IN 46184, USA
description:
Next Steps Logistics LLC is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner (DSP) looking for enthusiastic, team players to deliver Amazon packages. We offer full and part-time opportunities. We operate on 10-hour shifts and dispatch 6 days a week.
- Safely operate during every shift when loading and unloading packages to be delivered
- Be CUSTOMER OBSESSED!! We strive to deliver packages and smiles to our customers
- Work well with your Delivery Drive in a team environment
- Use Andriod handheld devices for routing information and customer delivery
- Must be comfortable working in varying weather conditions
- Lift packages up to 50 lbs. by yourself
- Operate a dolly or other tools used to move heavier items 50+ lbs.
- Able to get in and out of box trucks or step vans and walk up and down stairs through your shift
- Able to assist customers with special add-on services
- Be reliable, everyday
general_requirements:
- Must be at least 18 years old
- Eligible to work in the U.S
- Must have a valid driver's license or ID within the state of employment
- Must pass a drug test
benefits:
- Paid Training
- Paid Overtime and Time Off (PTO)
- Health Insurance and Benefits for full-time employees
- 401k with matching (Full-time only)
- Company-provided uniform
- Opportunities to pursue high school diplomas, degrees, certificates, and skill-building courses through Amazon's Next Mile program
- In-person classes for Microsoft programs, resume building, or any other training
schedule_details:
- Operational Monday - Saturday
- 8-10 hour shifts
- Open to a rotating schedule
- Shifts available 6 days per week

title: $22.25 HR+ : Delivery Driver - Great Lakes Solutions LLC (DGR8 - GLAK)
address: 3384 4 Mile Rd NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49544, USA
description:
This is a Full-Time driver position with Great Lakes Solutions LLC, delivering packages for Amazon!
We need reliable, independent, flexible, hard workers who pay attention to details, can quickly problem solve a wide range of situations, and win in a fast-paced environment!
Ideal candidates are enthusiastic, communicate effectively, and are ready to get the job done. Successful delivery drivers enjoy being out on the road driving, put safety first, and care deeply about customer expectations and satisfaction.
- Successfully handle and deliver packages on time
- Safely drive and perform safety inspections on Company vehicle, follow all local & state laws, road/driving regulations, and Company policies
- Provide excellent customer service and satisfaction despite stressful events / conditions
- Keep pace in physically demanding job; work in all weather conditions; lift packages (up to 50 lbs); get in and out of a van repeatedly throughout the day at variable locations
- Communicate effectively with support team to provide exceptional customer service and ensure deliveries are completed
- Use smart phone device for GPS Navigation, scanning packages, conducting administrative requirements such as clocking in/out, and communicate with supervisors and other team members
- Load and unload packages in delivery vehicle
- Support the team in daily work requirements including participation in rescue calls when other team members need assistance with their routes
general_requirements:
- Must be at least 21 years old
- Must have held state driver's license for at least 4 years
- Authorized to work in the United States
- Must pass a 4-Panel Drug Screening
- Must have a clean motor vehicle report (multiple violations can disqualify you from the position)
- Must have good English speaking, reading, writing / communication skills
- Commercial, DOT, CDL (or work-related) driving experience is a plus, but not mandatory
benefits:
- Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
- Paid time off begins accruing immediately at start of employment
- Paid biweekly
- A minimum of 2 paid 15-minute breaks during your shift and 1 unpaid 30-minute meal break
- Delivery Vehicle & Gas provided
- Handheld technology provided
- Uniforms provided
- Other safety and administrative gear necessary for job accomplishment
schedule_details:
- 10-hour shifts are typical
- 4-day workweek (40 hours) is typical (minimum of 1 day on the week, more are welcomed!)
- Expect a daytime shift starting no earlier than 10:00 AM

title: $22/hr - Cargo Driver - Next Steps Logistics LLC - Amazon DSP
address: 19 Bob Glidden Blvd, Whiteland, IN 46184, USA
description:
Next Steps Logistics LLC is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner (DSP) looking for enthusiastic, team players to deliver Amazon packages. We offer full and part-time opportunities. We operate on 10-hour shifts and dispatch 6 days a week.
- Safely drive and operate your delivery vehicle at all times
- Be CUSTOMER OBSESSED!! We strive to deliver packages and smiles to our customers.
- Use Android handheld devices for routing information and customer delivery
- Navigate a variety of routes throughout the delivery area
- Must be comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions
- Load and unload packages to be delivered
- Lift packages up to 50 lbs.
- Operate a dolly or other tools used to move heavier items 50+ lbs.
- Able to get in and out of step vans and walk up and down stairs through your shift
- Able to assist customers with special add-on services
- Be reliable, everyday
general_requirements:
- Must be at least 21 years old
- Eligible to work in the U.S
- Must have a valid driver's license within the state of employment
- Must pass a drug test
benefits:
- Paid time off
- Overtime
- Paid training
- Company-provided uniform
- Health insurance and benefits for all full-time employees
- 401k with matching
- Quarterly raises based on Safety, Customer feedback, and Attendance performance as a company
- Career growth opportunities such as moving into Lead Driver, Dispatcher, or Operations Manager roles, DOT certification, and professional development and training
- In-person classes for Microsoft programs, resume building, or any other training
schedule_details:
- Operational Monday - Saturday
- Open to a rotating schedule
- Open to an on-call shift at least once per week
- 8-10 hour shifts
- Overtime will be available
- Shifts range between 8-10 hours per day and shifts are available 6 days per week

title: $23.75hr - DJZ5 - New Jersey - Amazon DSP Delivery Driver
description:
Advanced Delivery Service has partnered with Amazon to provide delivery services to customers in The New Jersey area. Team Members will be utilizing BRAND NEW cargo vans containing the latest technology and safety features to deliver packages to homes, retail locations, and other delivery locations. In this role, you will play a vital part in ensuring our commitment to exceed customer expectations and make sure customer orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered on time at the right place.
- Adhere to strict safety and quality standards on and off the road
- Interact in a positive and professional manner with customers and the general public while delivering products to customers' homes, retail, and business locations
- Follow up on customer requests or problems with solution-oriented approach keeping the customer informed of delivery progress
- Use handheld technology to deliver customer packages, manage delivery progress, and solve issues
- Sort and prepare a delivery route to meet customer promise
- Ensure delivery vehicle is clean, fueled, and in good operating condition at all times
- May assist in training other team members
- Assist other Delivery team members in completing deliveries when behind
- If needed, carry out delivery station activities including sorting and general tasks
general_requirements:
- Ability to lift, bend, reach above the head, kneel, crouch, and/or stretch during shifts up to 12 hours

title: Amazon Delivery Driver $24.50/Hour + Bonuses
description:
Join the Speedbox Squad as a Package Delivery Driver to deliver Amazon packages in Broomfield. This parcel delivery courier job is a physical, outdoors job that involves working at a fast pace with continuous standing, walking, bending, climbing, and lifting packages weighing up to 50 lbs. To succeed as a package delivery driver, you must never compromise on safety, be self-motivated to work at a steady pace throughout an 8-10 hour day, and delight customers by insisting on high standards at every turn.
- Arrive to the delivery station at 11:00 AM, where you'll receive the keys to your delivery vehicle, conduct a pre-trip safety inspection, and attend a daily job briefing where we'll meet together as a team
- Lift packages into the delivery van at the start of each route, which requires hand lifting, pushing, pulling, and organizing 250 to 300 packages weighing up to 50 lbs each
- Bend, reach above our head, kneel, crouch, and stretch at each delivery stop while lifting and handling packages weighing up to 50 lbs
- Walk 8  12 miles per day while climbing 20  40 flights of stairs when delivering packages to the front door of homes in residential neighborhoods and multi-story apartment complexes
- Drive a high-roof cargo delivery van safely for 75  125 miles per day, while following all safe driving procedures regarding seat belt usage, speeding, and defensive driving
- Use a handheld smartphone for route navigation, to read customer delivery information, to speak and text message with dispatchers, and to accurately record the delivery status of packages at approximately 200 stops per shift
- Work outdoors and drive in all-weather conditions and various weather extremes, including hot temperatures, cold temperatures, rain, snow, and high wind
general_requirements:
- Must be 21 years of age or older
- Must have a valid driver's license
pay: $24.50/hour starting pay, plus rescue bonus ($1.00/stop rescued if you assist other drivers after completing your full route)
benefits:
- 2 weeks Paid Time Off (employees begin accruing PTO on their first day)
- Weekly pay every Friday via direct deposit
- Guaranteed minimum 36 hours/week (if you complete 4 regular routes each week)
- Up to $5250/year in tuition education benefits
- 401(k) with retirement matching (50% of the first 4% you save, vesting after 24 months)
- Subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans for full-time employees
- 3 day weekends (work 4 days a week with 3 days off)
- Delivery vehicle provided
- Paid training
schedule_details:
- Starts at 11:00 AM every day
- Each delivery route typically takes 8-10 hours to complete
- Generally finishing before 9:30 PM
- Full-time team members work 4 days a week, 36-40 hours a week
- Minimum of one weekend day required
- Shift schedule options include Thu-Sun, Fri-Mon, and Sat-Tue

address: 6711 Belvedere Road, West Palm Beach, FL, USA

Principal Delivery, LLC is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner looking for enthusiastic, team players to join our team. We are seeking a motivated and organized Amazon DSP Dispatcher to join our fast-paced delivery service team. As a Dispatcher, you will play a crucial role in coordinating and optimizing the daily delivery operations, ensuring efficient and timely package deliveries to Amazon customers. This role requires excellent communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment.
- Monitor and track the progress of deliveries throughout the day

- Identify and address operational challenges and exceptions that may impact delivery schedules
- Collaborate with drivers to find solutions to unforeseen issues

- Address any safety or compliance concerns promptly
- Occasionally, candidates will be required to take delivery routes, including driving a delivery vehicle to ensure on-time deliveries to customers

- Set a positive example for the team by demonstrating a strong work ethic and commitment to fulfilling job responsibilities

- Proficiency in using dispatch software and tracking tools
- Strong communication and problem-solving skills
- Excellent time management and organizational abilities
- Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing situations
- Knowledge of geographical areas and road networks in the delivery service area
- Valid driver's license and a willingness to occasionally take delivery routes when needed
- Must be able to pass a drug test and driving records check
- Must have good critical thinking skills to analyze complex situations, make informed decisions, and adapt to changing circumstances

- Coordinate and oversee 40+ daily delivery routes for drivers, ensuring all packages are delivered on time and in the most efficient manner
- Manage the daily loadout/dispatch process to ensure all drivers are equipped to start delivery on time
- Manage end of day/closing process (vehicle inspection, asset return, RTS oversight, ensuring vehicles are parked properly for mobile fueling and maintenance)
- Constantly monitor routes (Cortex) and safety (Netradyne), providing updates/feedback and immediate coaching as necessary to ensure consistent adherence to safety and delivery requirements
- Address any issues or challenges drivers may encounter during their routes and provide solutions to ensure timely deliveries
- Ensure that all drivers adhere to company policies, safety standards, and regulatory requirements
- Maintain accurate records of dispatch activities, driver logs, and delivery data
- Prepare daily and weekly reports for management review
- Effectively communicate with Amazon station management (verbally and via Chime) on route progress and barriers
- Ensure all on-the-road incidents are properly reported and documented within 24 hours
- Complete new driver ridealongs and training
- Willingness to go on road to sweep/execute routes if operationally required
general_requirements:
- All Dispatcher candidates must complete a trial period as a Delivery Associate to before fully transitioning into the Dispatcher role
- 1+ years of Amazon Delivery Driver experience
- 1+ years of Dispatch experience
- Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to provide clear and concise instructions
- Proficiency in using Cortex routing and dispatch software, as well as standard office and communication software (Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Chime, WhatsApp etc)
- Problem-solving skills with the ability to think on your feet and make quick decisions
- At least 21 years old and legally authorized to work in the U.S.
- Valid (non-provisional) driver's license within the state of Maryland
benefits:
- Weekly Performance Incentives
- Up to $5,250 in tuition reimbursement available per year
- Weekly Pay
- $125 Zappos credit towards the purchase of safety shoes each year
- 401(k) with employer match
- Paid training
- Employer subsidized medical insurance
- Dental, Vision, Disability, Hospital, Critical illness, Accident and Life Insurance available
schedule_details:
- Flexibility to work weekends, holidays, or overtime as needed
- Availability to work 10 hour shift, 4 days a week (including one weekend day)

title: Delivery Associate - Earthling Deliveries! @ DDX7
description:
Earthling Deliveries is looking to hire new full-time and part-time Delivery Associates immediately to deliver packages in the growing and greater Forney area.
You will drive our Company vans and deliver packages to homes and businesses throughout the Forney area. Starting from the Amazon station in Forney, you will load packages and follow a pre-planned delivery route. Together, we will deliver thousands of smiles every day!
- Successfully handle and deliver packages on time
- Safely drive and perform safety inspections on company vehicle, follow all local & state laws, road/driving regulations, and Company policies
- Provide excellent customer service and satisfaction despite stressful events / conditions
- Keep pace in physically demanding job; work in all weather conditions; lift packages (up to 50 lbs.); get in and out of a van repeatedly throughout the day at variable locations
- Communicate effectively with support team to provide exceptional customer service and ensure deliveries are completed
- Use smart phone device for GPS Navigation, scanning packages, conducting administrative requirements such as clocking in/out, and communicate with supervisors and other team members
- Load and unload packages in delivery vehicle
- Support the team in daily work requirements including participation in rescue calls when other team members need assistance with their routes
general_requirements:
- Be at least 21 years of age
- Have a valid non-provisional, unrestricted driver's license that has not expired
- Authorized to work in the United States
- Must pass a 4-panel drug screen (which does not include pre-employment testing for marijuana)
- Must have a clean motor vehicle report (multiple violations can disqualify you from the position)
- Must have good English speaking, reading, writing / communication skills
- Have reliable transportation to get to and from work
- Must be able to get in and out of a van frequently throughout the day (in all types of weather)  you will have 200 or more stops every shift
- Must be a safe driver as this is evaluated on a driver performance APP and by in-vehicle cameras
benefits:
- Weekly bonus potential based on driver and overall team performance
- Overtime is paid at time-and-a-half over 40 hours per week
- Drivers who finish their routes before the end of their scheduled shift may be eligible to receive a daily bonus, equivalent to having their hours rounded up to 9hrs for the day
- Health benefits (medical, dental and vision) for full-time Delivery Associates who regularly work at least 30 hours per week
- Paid every two weeks (biweekly)
- Opportunity for performance and incentive bonuses
- A minimum of 2 paid 15-minute breaks during your shift and 1 unpaid 30-minute meal break
- Paid time off (PTO) begins accruing immediately at start of employment
- Delivery Vehicle & Gas provided
- Handheld technology provided
- Uniforms provided
- Other safety and administrative gear necessary for job accomplishment
- Flexible schedule
- 401k program
schedule_details:
- Full time drivers can anticipate 34 to 40 hours a week
- Routes are designed to be completed in 10 hours; therefore, most drivers are scheduled for rolling 4 day shifts (4 days on and 4 days off)
- Earthling Deliveries delivers 7 days a week which means drivers rotate weekend shifts
- Must be able to work weekends as needed
- Start time of 11:15am
- 10 hour shift
- Delivery Associates will have the opportunity to pick up additional shifts to cover team members during illness or emergencies and based on business needs

Sheena Logistics LLC is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner (DSP) looking for reliable and energetic team players to fill multiple full-time delivery driver positions to deliver Amazon packages. This position will load and unload packages from a company-owned delivery vehicle, drive to customer locations and safely deliver packages and follow customer instructions. title: Delivery Associate - Sinaro Logistics LLC - Forest Park, Georgia
address: 2125 Anvil Block Road, Forest Park, GA, USA
description:
SINARO Logistics LLC is an Amazon Delivery Service Partner based in Forest Park, Georgia. We are locally operated Family-owned business that prides itself on the professionalism and capabilities of our team. We believe in servicing customers first, efficiency, acting with integrity, winning as one and recognizing great performers. We operate 7 days a week, 361 days a year.
We are looking for reliable, independent, flexible, and hard-working people who prioritize safety, are detail-oriented, and can win in a fast-paced environment!
Ideal candidates are enthusiastic, can communicate effectively, and are ready to get the job done. In order to become successful delivery drivers, candidates must enjoy being out on the road driving, putting safety first, and caring deeply about customer expectations and satisfaction, among others.
As a delivery associate, you will be subject to the following responsibilities while loading and delivering customer packages. Delivery drivers are eligible to work up to three to four, Full-Day shifts per week, including weekends and holiday shifts.
- Safely drive and perform safety inspections on company vehicles
- Follow all local & state laws, road/driving regulations, and company policies
- Successfully handle and deliver packages on time
- Provide excellent customer service and satisfaction despite stressful events/conditions
- Keep up with the pace in a physically demanding work environment; work in all weather conditions; lift packages (up to 50 lbs.); get in and out of a van repeatedly throughout the day at variable locations
- Communicate effectively with the support team to provide exceptional customer service and to ensure deliveries are completed
- Use a smartphone device for GPS Navigation, to scan packages, to conduct administrative requirements such as clocking in/out, and to communicate with supervisors and other team members
- Load and unload packages to and from the delivery vehicle
- Support the team in daily work requirements such as through participation in rescue calls when other team members need assistance with their routes
- Always conduct oneself in a highly ethical manner
- Show excellent attention to detail
- Solve problems independently using critical thinking skills
- Work in a self-directed environment with an upbeat attitude
- Work with a team in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
- Behave responsibly and courteously towards others
- Embrace our culture of teamwork, honor, and commitment
general_requirements:
- Must be at least 21 years of age
- Must have a valid driver's license (CDL not required)
- Authorized to work in the United States
- Must pass Drug Screening
- Must have a clean motor vehicle report (multiple violations may disqualify you from the position)
- Have and maintain a positive attitude
- Fluent in English (bilingual/multilingual is a bonus)
- Able to complete mandatory training
- Available to work weekends and holidays
- Lift a maximum of 50 pounds during an 8 to 10-hour work shift
- Appropriately handle stressful driving demands including inclement weather conditions
- Climb stairs, reach overhead, squat/bend/kneel during an 8 to 10-hour work shift
- High school or equivalent (Preferred)
- Driving: 1 year (preferred)
benefits:
- Health benefits package includes medical, dental, and vision coverage
- Paid time off, paid training, bonuses, and incentive plans
- Paid biweekly
- Subject to increase over time with performance
- All of our vans are suited with COVID supplies

title: Dispatcher - Outlaw Logistics LLC
description:
As a Dispatcher at Outlaw Logistics, you will play a critical role in coordinating the daily operations of our fleet. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that our drivers deliver packages in a timely and efficient manner while providing excellent customer service. You will communicate with drivers, monitor delivery routes, and adjust scheduling as needed to meet changing demands. This role requires exceptional organizational skills, strong communication abilities, and a commitment to working in a fast-paced environment.
- Coordinate and manage daily delivery routes for drivers, ensuring all packages are delivered on time and in the most efficient manner
- Maintain clear and timely communication with drivers, providing them with route updates and delivery instructions as needed
- Monitor driver performance, providing feedback and coaching as necessary to ensure consistent adherence to company policies and procedures (You will be calling drivers when they receive camera alerts)
- Continuously evaluate routes and schedules to identify opportunities for improvement and optimize delivery efficiency

title: Package Delivery Driver $180/Day
description:
Join the Skedaddle Squad which is hiring immediately for multiple Package Delivery Driver positions to deliver FedEx packages in Salina. Skedaddle Inc. is a FedEx contractor responsible for delivering packages to Concordia, Smith Center, Washington, Beloit, and Belleville. This parcel delivery courier job is a physical, outdoors job that involves working at a fast pace with continuous standing, walking, bending, climbing, and lifting packages weighing up to 150 lbs.
- Arrive to the delivery station at 08:30 AM, where you'll receive the keys to your delivery vehicle, conduct a pre-trip safety inspection, and attend a daily job briefing where we'll meet together as a team
- Lift packages into the delivery van at the start of each route, which requires hand lifting, pushing, pulling, and organizing 50 to 150 packages weighing up to 150 lbs each
- Bend, reach above our head, kneel, crouch, and stretch at each delivery stop while lifting and handling packages weighing up to 150 lbs
- Walk 8  12 miles per day while climbing 10  20 flights of stairs when delivering packages to the front door of homes in residential neighborhoods and multi-story apartment complexes
- Drive a step van or cutaway delivery van safely for 100  250 miles per day, while following all safe driving procedures regarding seat belt usage, speeding, and defensive driving
- Use a handheld smartphone for route navigation, to read customer delivery information, to speak and text message with dispatchers, and to accurately record the delivery status of packages at approximately 50-100 stops per shift
- Work outdoors and drive in all-weather conditions and various weather extremes, including hot temperatures, cold temperatures, rain, snow, and high wind
general_requirements:
- Must be 21 years of age or older
- Must have a valid driver's license
- Must be able to pass both pre-employment and random five-panel drug tests which includes testing for marijuana, THC, and cannabis
- Must be able to pass a DOT physical and obtain a DOT medical examiners card
- Must be able to lift packages weighing up to 150 lbs
- Must be able to walk 8-12 miles per day while climbing 10-20 flights of stairs
pay: $18.00/hour or $180/day, whichever is higher (equivalent to $20.00-$22.50/hour based on 8-9 hour routes)
benefits:
- Paid Time Off: Employees begin accruing PTO on their first day and can earn 1 hour of PTO for every 30 hours worked
- Weekly Pay: Paid every Tuesday via direct deposit
- 3 Day Weekends: Full-time team members work 4 days a week with 3 days off
- Subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans for full-time employees
- 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Matching: Skedaddle Inc. matches 50% of the first 4% you save towards retirement, vesting after 24 months of employment
- Paid training provided
- Delivery vehicle provided
- All delivery vehicles are equipped with a vehicle telematics system and dash camera
schedule_details:
- Start time: 08:30 AM every day
- Each delivery route will typically take 8-10 hours to complete
- Generally finishing before 6:30 PM
- Full-time team members work 4 days a week, 32-40 hours a week
- Including a minimum of one weekend day

title: Package Delivery Driver- Amazon DSP- Tailwind Delivery LLC
description:
Now hiring Full-Time Delivery Driver positions with Tailwind Delivery LLC, delivering packages out Amazon's DKY9 warehouse in Florence, KY. We deliver across the Northern Kentucky region!
Tailwind Delivery LLC is a Delivery Service Partner with Amazon! As we grow we will be looking to promote high performing team members into leadership positions.

- Must pass a 4-Panel Drug Screening (Opioids, Phencyclidine (PCP), Cocaine, and Amphetamines)
- Must have a clean motor vehicle report
- Must have good English speaking, reading, writing / communication skills

- Paid time off begins accruing immediately at start of employment

- 401K plan
- Tuition Re-imbursement program

- Paid Training

- Delivery Vehicle & Gas
- Handheld technology
- Uniform
- Other safety and administrative gear necessary for job accomplishment

title: XL Box Truck Delivery Driver
address: 805 South Briggs Avenue, Durham, North Carolina, US
description:
As an XL Non-CDL Box Truck Delivery Driver, you will play a crucial role in the efficient and timely delivery of oversized packages and goods; with the potential for install/assembly as well as scheduled return pickups. Packages can range from furniture and appliances to TV's and gym equipment etc. Operating 16-foot or 26-foot Box Truck vehicles, you will navigate through designated routes to ensure that Amazon's commitment to exceptional customer service is upheld.
- Safely operate an extra-large delivery vehicle to transport oversized packages to their designated locations
- Adhere to all traffic laws, regulations, and Amazon's safety protocols
- Maintain metrics related to attendance, performance, and safety
- Conduct routine vehicle inspections and report any maintenance or safety issues promptly
- Maintain the vehicle used for deliveries (refueling, and cleanliness)
- Handle oversized packages with care, ensuring they are securely loaded and unloaded from the delivery vehicle
- Adhere to all safety guidelines while lifting products
- Provide excellent customer service during deliveries, addressing customer inquiries and concerns professionally
- Greet customers professionally upon arrival, providing excellent customer service
- Inspect all items before assembly and installation to ensure they are not damaged and meet quality standards
- Assemble products upon delivery, ensuring that items are set up according to manufacturer instructions
- Ensure that products are assembled safely, using proper tools and techniques
- Verify that the products are functioning correctly and that any necessary tests are completed before leaving the customer's location
- Effectively use Amazon's delivery technology, mobile apps, and handheld devices for tracking deliveries and updating delivery statuses
- Report any technology-related issues promptly
general_requirements:
- Eligible to work in the U.S.
- Have a valid North Carolina Driver's License - Commercial Driver's License Not Required (NON-CDL)
- At least 21 years of age
- Proven experience as a delivery driver, in oversized or heavy-load transportation, preferred
- Install and Assembly experience preferred
- Have a clean motor vehicle report (multiple violations can disqualify you from the position)
- Pass Department of Transportation (DOT) physical and obtain DOT Medical Examiner Certification (current/valid/or willing to obtain one before starting)
- Strong communication and customer service skills
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team
- Ability to use navigation GPS tools without aid
- Ability to operate a smartphone without aid
- Ability to pass a DOT Physical
- Physical fitness to handle heavy and oversized packages
- Push/Pull large parcels using dollies and other specialized equipment (Packages weighing between 50-200 lbs; some will be team-lift)
- Lifting 70 lbs. (one person lifts) or 300lbs. (Two person lifts) delivering larger parcels that may include furniture, appliances, athletic equipment and other large items
- Ability to walk a brisk 15-minute mile
- Ability to lift packages and bundles weighing up to 70lbs multiple times during a route
- Ability to climb stairs on a regular basis
- Must be comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions
benefits:
- Paid Time Off (PTO)
- Health Insurance (not applicable to seasonal)
- Dental Insurance (not applicable to seasonal)
- Vision Insurance (not applicable to seasonal)
- Vehicle
- Fuel Card
- Receive up to $5,250 per year in tuition assistance towards continued education such as bachelor's and associate degrees, skill certifications, English language proficiency, and high school-level coursework (not applicable to seasonal)

title: Operation Manager
address: 253 W. Louise Ave, Suite B, Manteca, CA 95336
description: Responsible for optimizing and overseeing the daily operations to ensure efficiency, safety, and compliance with regulatory standards. Develop and implement quality control procedures to maintain safety and performance standards for vehicles while leveraging advanced technologies and predictive maintenance techniques to improve operational efficiency, reliability, and minimize downtime. Logistics optimization, especially for sustainable energy vehicles, ensuring adherence to environmental and sustainability guidelines. Develop and implement supply chain strategies to improve efficiency and reduce costs. Oversee maintenance schedules, inventory management, vendor relationships, and procurement processes to ensure the timely availability of critical components. Manage budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting, implementing cost-saving measures without compromising quality. Ensuring compliance with legal, environmental, and safety regulations, along with identifying risks and developing mitigation strategies. Lead change management initiatives, oversee logistics, including warehousing and shipping, and align operational strategies with the company's long-term vision. Responsible for driving efficiency, enhancing customer satisfaction, and fostering continuous innovation across various business functions. Coordinate with senior management to align operational goals with the company's vision. Oversee technology upgrades and implement tools to streamline operations. Plan and oversee logistics, including inventory control, shipping, and warehousing. Drive change management initiatives to adapt to market and industry shifts. Utilize data analytics to improve efficiency. Collaborate with other departments such as finance, sales, and production to align with overall business objectives.
general_requirements:
- Master's or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering (Any), or any related field
- 1 year of experience in the job offered, Manufacturing Engineer, Operations Engineer, Business Manager or related
schedule_details:
- 40 Hours/Week
- Permanent position
- Full time

title: 2nd Shift Medical Driver - Houston, TX (Full Time) Mon - Fri 1:30pm-10pm   $14.50/hr
description:
Most of your day will be spent in a company-owned vehicle, safely driving and transporting lab specimens, medical records, pharmaceuticals, x-rays, hospital supplies, interoffice mail and related materials
- Operate a hand-held scanning device to accurately track items through the transportation cycle
- Strictly observe operating policies, procedures and service schedules
- Present a professional image to clients and the public through appearance and interaction
- Load and unload company vehicles with appropriate equipment
- Demonstrate safe and courteous driving behavior
- Conduct pre/post-trip vehicle inspections and maintain a clean, neat and orderly vehicle
- Route duties vary based on client and business needs, and LSRs must be able to perform all duties across all routes they may be assigned. Route assignments may change from time to time.
- Demonstrate teamwork, cooperation and adaptability with teammates and clients
- Build and nurture a collaborative MedSpeed team culture
general_requirements:
- Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
- Must be 19 years of age with an active driver's license for 3 years
- Demonstrated dependability and reliability
- Familiarity working with and adapting to technology
- Demonstrated ability to follow procedures closely
- Ability to determine efficient routing between multiple points
- Ability to pass initial and random drug & alcohol screen
- Drive a non-commercial vehicle throughout the shift on various roads and in varying weather conditions
- Must have an excellent driving history
- Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination depending on location and local mandates
- Must be able to regularly lift and carry items weighing up to 50 pounds
- While drop-off and pick-up responsibilities may vary and routes may be inconsistent, the ability to handle varying item weights and physical demands is always required
- Must be able to lift items off storage racks
- Must be comfortable walking long distances and standing for long periods of time
- As part of our hiring process, final candidates will be subject to a background check, in compliance with applicable laws
benefits:
- Training Provided  Our Blue Shirt Certified program ensures you excel in your role
- Opportunities for Career Advancement  Over 50% of our market managers have been promoted into their roles
- Medical, Dental, Vision and FSA  We offer plans that help you and your family take care of your whole self
- 401(K)  Helping you make good financial decisions today and for the future
- Paid Time Off  We value well-being and encourage work life balance
- Company Vehicle  No need to worry about maintenance or gas reimbursement
- Fixed Schedules  Schedule consistency and predictability
schedule_details:
- Monday through Friday 1:30pm-10pm
- 2nd shift
- Full Time

Most of your day will be spent in a company-owned vehicle, safely driving and transporting lab specimens, medical records, pharmaceuticals, x-rays, hospital supplies, interoffice mail and related materials.
- Load and unload company vehicle with appropriate equipment.
- Operate a hand-held scanning device to track items throughout the transportation cycle.
- Observe operating policies, procedures and service schedules.
- Demonstrate safe and courteous driving behavior.
- Conduct pre/post-trip vehicle inspections and maintain a clean, neat and orderly vehicle.
- Route duties vary based on client and business needs, and LSRs must be able to perform all duties across all routes they may be assigned. Route assignments may change from time to time.
- Demonstrate teamwork, cooperation and adaptability with teammates and clients.
- Build and nurture a collaborative MedSpeed team culture.
general_requirements:
- High school diploma or equivalent.
- Relevant industry/driving experience is a plus.
- Strong customer service and interpersonal skills.
- Must be 19 years of age with an active driver's license for 3 years.
- Must have excellent driving history.
- Familiarity working with and adapting to technology.
- Ability to pass initial and random drug & alcohol screen.
- Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination depending on location and local mandates (Initial dose only, booster is not required).
- Must be able to regularly lift and carry items weighing up to 50 pounds
- While drop-off and pick-up responsibilities may vary and routes may be inconsistent, the ability to handle varying item weights and physical demands is always required
- Must be able to lift items off storage racks.
- Must be comfortable with walking and standing for long periods of time.
- Must complete a criminal background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle record (MVR) review.
benefits:
- Medical, Dental, Vision and FSA
- 401(K)
- Paid Time Off
- Company Vehicle  No need to worry about maintenance or gas reimbursement.
- Training Provided  Our Blue Shirt Certified program ensures you excel in your role.
- Opportunities for Career Advancement  Over 50% of our market managers have been promoted into their roles.
schedule_details:
Part-time
Mon & Tues 1030am-630pm
Fixed Schedules  Schedule consistency and predictability.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Our Operations Supervisor role is responsible for the daily operation of a healthcare transportation network, including supervision and coaching of Logistics Service Representatives, management of client relationships, and attainment of location service quality and profit objectives.
- Overall leadership of Logistics Service Representatives, including recruitment, onboarding, training, performance management and development
- Manage service quality and efficiency through daily observations, monitoring of exception and performance reports and follow up coaching
- Perform Logistics Service Representative route observations to ensure compliance with safety, client and operational procedures and identify improvement opportunities
- Ensure accuracy and ongoing system maintenance of route, client and variable stop data
- Review daily vehicle pre/post trip inspection checklists, coordinate repairs and maintenance with vendors and maintain maintenance history file
- Assist operations team with projects to improve operational efficiency and service quality
- All other job-related duties as assigned
- Work to promote MedSpeed team culture
general_requirements:
- Bachelor's degree preferred in Business, Operations, Supply Chain Management or related field
- 1-3 years of progressive business experience preferred
- Successful experience applying quality management principles
- Strong project management skills
- Excellent written and oral communication, strong interpersonal skills
- Strong customer relation skills, demonstrated ability to interact with key decision makers
- Process-oriented mindset focused on continuous improvement, excellent problem-solving skills
- Collaborative work style, able to work well within and across departments
- Result & action oriented with a sense of urgency
- Rational thinker with the ability to excel in stressful situations
- Demonstrated leadership ability
- Strong computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite proficiency
benefits:
- Medical, dental, and vision coverage
- Flexible spending accounts
- Paid time off
- 401(k)
schedule_details:
Monday-Friday 9:00 PM - 5:30 PM
On Call 1 Weekend Per Month and 1 Evening Per Week

title: Weekend Medical Delivery Driver -Lufkin, TX  Sat and Sun 8:30am-5pm   $14.00 hourly
description:
Join MedSpeed and help deliver health! We're a healthcare logistics company partnering with organizations nationwide to transport vital medical supplies and specimens.
- Most of your day will be spent in a company-owned vehicle, safely driving and transporting lab specimens, medical records, pharmaceuticals, x-rays, hospital supplies, interoffice mail and related materials
- Operate a hand-held scanning device to accurately track items through the transportation cycle
- Strictly observe operating policies, procedures and service schedules
- Present a professional image to clients and the public through appearance and interaction
- Load and unload company vehicles with appropriate equipment
- Demonstrate safe and courteous driving behavior
- Conduct pre/post-trip vehicle inspections and maintain a clean, neat and orderly vehicle
- Route duties vary based on client and business needs, and LSRs must be able to perform all duties across all routes they may be assigned. Route assignments may change from time to time.
- Demonstrate teamwork, cooperation and adaptability with teammates and clients
- Build and nurture a collaborative MedSpeed team culture
general_requirements:
- Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
- Must be 19 years of age with an active driver's license for 3 years
- Demonstrated dependability and reliability
- Familiarity working with and adapting to technology
- Demonstrated ability to follow procedures closely
- Ability to determine efficient routing between multiple points
- Ability to pass initial and random drug & alcohol screen
- Drive a non-commercial vehicle throughout the shift on various roads and in varying weather conditions
- Must have an excellent driving history
- Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination depending on location and local mandates
- Must be able to regularly lift and carry items weighing up to 50 pounds
- While drop-off and pick-up responsibilities may vary and routes may be inconsistent, the ability to handle varying item weights and physical demands is always required
- Must be able to lift items off storage racks
- Must be comfortable walking long distances and standing for long periods of time
- All candidates receiving an offer must complete a criminal background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle record (MVR) review

title: Delivery Driver
description:
The RedWagon Delivers is seeking individuals who know how to hustle and grind! Our ideal candidate works for Doordash, GrubHub, and/or Uber Eats, may have experience with catering delivery, and understands that working for RedWagon adds to their total earnings. They also understand 1099 work and what it means to be an independent contractor.
You must be customer-service oriented and available to make deliveries from a variety of locations in the region. Most deliveries take 30 minutes & occur between the hours of 9AM-2PM. However, we make deliveries from 6AM to 9PM, 7 days a week.
- Pick up food or other items and drop them off at designated locations ON TIME
- Must be willing to accept all levels of pay
- Transport food carefully and safely from restaurant to the destination
- Perform light set up order where the customer requests (set-up only)
- You are expected to act and dress as a professional and be well groomed when representing The RedWagon Delivers on all your deliveries
- Provide stellar customer service
general_requirements:
- At least 21 years of age
- A valid U.S. driver's license
- A smart phone
- Ability to follow instructions
- Communication skills
- Ability to figure things out
- Ability to navigate using smartphone mapping application
- High school degree
- If hired, you must purchase your own equipment which includes catering delivery bags (23X13X15) and a collapsible cart, wagon, or a convertible or foldable hand truck
benefits: - Flexible schedule
schedule_details:
- Most deliveries take 30 minutes & occur between the hours of 9AM-2PM
- We make deliveries from 6AM to 9PM, 7 days a week
- Monday to Friday
- Weekend availability
- Your availability determines your opportunities

title: Delivery Driver
description:
We are seeking individuals who know how to hustle and grind! Our ideal candidate works for Doordash, GrubHub, and/or Uber Eats, may have experience with catering delivery, and understands that working for RedWagon adds to their total earnings. They also understand 1099 work and what it means to be an independent contractor.
You must be customer-service oriented and available to make deliveries from a variety of locations in the region. Most deliveries take 30 minutes & occur between the hours of 9AM-2PM. However, we make deliveries from 6AM to 9PM, 7 days a week.
- Pick up food or other items and drop them off at designated locations ON TIME
- Must be willing to accept all levels of pay
- Transport food carefully and safely from restaurant to the destination
- Perform light set up order where the customer requests (set-up only)
- You are expected to act and dress as a professional and be well groomed when representing The RedWagon Delivers on all your deliveries
- Provide stellar customer service
general_requirements:
- At least 21 years of age
- A valid U.S. driver's license
- A smart phone
- Your own vehicle (A van or truck is not required)
- Ability to follow instructions
- Communication skills
- Ability to figure things out
- Ability to navigate using smartphone mapping application
- If hired, you must purchase your own equipment which includes catering delivery bags (23X13X15) and a collapsible cart, wagon, or a convertible or foldable hand truck

- Flexible schedule
- Next day pay
